channel.title: Ocaml on Martin Trojer

item.title: This year in F#
item.description: For the third year running, here’s my annual (and extremely subjective) review of the state of the F# language, its community and other loosely connected things. How would I sum up the noises coming from F# the last year? Pretty darn awesome. A lot of what’s been happening was on my wish-list outlined in last year’s post. What are the highlights?
